intro: Pterostemma frigidum, commonly known as the Arctic pterostemma, is a rare flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and slender, hairy stems. It thrives in cold, moist environments and is often found in tundra and alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
